arm_group.description: Categorized as non-frail based on Fried's five phenotypic criteria (Fried L.P., et al. Frailty in Older Adults: Evidence for a Phenotype. Journal of Gerontology: 2001, Vol. 56A, No. 3, M146-M156)
Categorized as pre-frail based on Fried's five phenotypic criteria (Fried L.P., et al. Frailty in Older Adults: Evidence for a Phenotype. Journal of Gerontology: 2001, Vol. 56A, No. 3, M146-M156)
Categorized as frail based on Fried's five phenotypic criteria (Fried L.P., et al. Frailty in Older Adults: Evidence for a Phenotype. Journal of Gerontology: 2001, Vol. 56A, No. 3, M146-M156)

brief_summary.textblock:
BioSensics has developed a Physical Activity Monitoring System (PAMSys) that consists of a
      single wearable motion sensor that is worn on the torso. The objectives of this
      observational study are the following: 1) to test the efficacy of PAMSys for objectively
      assessing a persons risk of falling based on activity data measured during activities of
      daily living and 2) to test the efficacy of PAMSys for identifying precise early physical
      activity or functioning indicators of frailty in those who are pre-frail or frail as
      compared to non-frail controls.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Activity Monitoring in Frailty and Falling

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Community-dwelling ambulatory men or women ages 65 and above

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Mental Status Mini Exam score < 23

          -  Those who are unwilling or unable to comprehend informed consent

study_pop.textblock:
Pima County Arizona elders aged 65+ will be recruited from the Arizona Center on Aging
        affiliated geriatrics clinics.

facility.name: University of Arizona Interdisciplinary Consortium on Advance Motion Performance
University of Arizona Center on Aging

clinical_study.official_title: Phase II STTR: Portable Device for Telecare Monitoring of Elderly People

other_outcome.description: Fried L.P., et al. Frailty in Older Adults: Evidence for a Phenotype. Journal of Gerontology: 2001, Vol. 56A, No. 3, M146-M156
other_outcome.measure: Fraility as categorized based on Fried's five phenotypic criteria

other_outcome.description: Fried L.P., et al. Frailty in Older Adults: Evidence for a Phenotype. Journal of Gerontology: 2001, Vol. 56A, No. 3, M146-M156
other_outcome.measure: Fraility as categorized based on Fried's five phenotypic criteria

oversight_info.authority: United States: University of Arizona Human Subjects Protection Program

primary_outcome.description: Eligible subjects will receive a PAMSys motion sensors and necessary instructions for proper use. They will then wear the motion sensor continuously for 48 hours. PAMSys will record the duration of each sit-to-stand transition during this 48 hour monitoring period. The primary outcome measure is the average of these durations.
primary_outcome.measure: Average sit-to-stand transition time over 48-hour monitoring period

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Eligible subjects will receive a PAMSys motion sensors and necessary instructions for proper use. They will then wear the motion sensor continuously for 48 hours. PAMSys will record the duration of each stand-to-sit transition during this 48 hour monitoring period. The primary outcome measure is the average of these durations.
secondary_outcome.measure: Average stand-to-sit transition time during 48 hours of continuous monitoring

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
